title: About me
text:
About me
I am a PhD student in statistics. My subject is Multisite stochastic generation of multivariate weather time series.
I am a part of the R38 team at EDF, as well as in MIA-PS team at INRAE, both located in Palaiseau.

Where to find me

Monday, Tuesday : Opale-1-EF-01 - EDF Lab Paris-Saclay, 7 Bd Gaspard Monge, 91120 Palaiseau
Wednesday, Thursday : E3-710 - AgroParisTech, 22 place de l’Agronomie, 91120 Palaiseau
Friday : any

title: Collapse-callout Example
text:
Callout Blocks

title: Collapse-callout Example
text:
More callout blocks






Expand To Learn About Collapse



This is an example of a ‘folded’ caution callout that can be expanded by the user. You can use collapse="true" to collapse it by default or collapse="false" to make a collapsible callout that is expanded by default.








Important

warning

title: New package : SpatialBernoulli.jl
text:
My very first package
I am pleased to announce that my very first real package is available on GitHub : SpatialBernoulli



Some realisations of a spatially correlated binary variable…




Installation
The package runs on julia 1.11 and above. In a Julia session switch to pkg> mode to add the package:
julia>] # switch to pkg> mode
pkg> add https://github.com/caroline-cognot/SpatialBernoulli.jl
To run an example, see documentation.
For now, model fitting relies on Optimization.


How did I build this package ?
Followed instructions from

https://julialang.org/contribute/developing_package/ for the creation of the package using PkgTemplates
https://documenter.juliadocs.org/stable/man/guide/ for setting up the documentation
https://m3g.github.io/JuliaNotes.jl/stable/publish_docs/ for publishing the documentation



How did I build this page ?
Followed the code of Léo Micollet who followed the instructions of Lucia Clarotto who followed the instructions she gave us in StateoftheR session.

text:

Caroline Cognot

My first article is published

No matching items

title: My first article is published
text:
Publication success !
I am pleased to announce that my very first paper is published here : A spatio-temporal weather generator for the temperature over France. It is a joint paper with my supervisors, Liliane Bel, Sylvie Parey and David Métivier.
It talks about the modelling of mean daily temperature at the scale of France, incorporating trends, seasonality and spatio-temporal geostatistics.



Article thumbnail image
